channel.title: 3 on Carl Müller-Crepon
channel.description: Recent content in 3 on Carl Müller-Crepon

item.title: Cracking or Packing Ethnic Groups? The Colonial Design of Administrative Units in Sub-Saharan Africa
item.description: I study the roots of colonial administrative unit designs in ethnic geography.

item.title: The Ethnic Politics of Nature Protection: Ethnic Favoritism and Protected Areas in Africa
item.description: We study the effect of ethnic politics on the allocation of protected areas.

item.title: Rulers on the Road: Itinerant Rule in the Holy Roman Empire, AD 919–1519
item.description: We study the geography of the itineraries of the emperors of the Holy Roman Empire.

item.title: Indirect Rule, Cash Crop Production, and Development in Africa
item.description: Indirect colonial rule through precolonial institutions improved the developmental impact of cash crop agriculture.
